feature: Add focus trapping and role attributes to AlertDialog modal components
description: Implement proper focus management in AlertDialog components including focus trapping, role="dialog", aria-modal="true", and automatic focus return to trigger element on close.

phases.title: Create useFocusTrap Hook
phases.description: Create a reusable React hook that implements focus trapping, Escape key handling, and focus restoration for modal components.

subtasks.title: Create useFocusTrap hook file
subtasks.description: Create a new hook at web/src/hooks/useFocusTrap.js that implements focus trapping logic. The hook should: 1) Store the previously focused element on mount, 2) Find all focusable elements within the container, 3) Handle Tab/Shift+Tab to cycle through focusable elements, 4) Trap focus within the container, 5) Return focus to the trigger element on cleanup.
acceptance_criteria: Hook accepts a ref to the container element and an isActive boolean
Hook stores the previously focused element when activated
Hook finds all focusable elements (buttons, inputs, links, etc.) within container
Tab key cycles forward through focusable elements
Shift+Tab cycles backward through focusable elements
Focus wraps from last to first element and vice versa
Focus returns to previously focused element on cleanup
subtasks.notes: Created useFocusTrap hook at web/src/hooks/useFocusTrap.ts with all required functionality: stores previously focused element, finds focusable elements, handles Tab/Shift+Tab cycling, traps focus within container, and returns focus on cleanup. Also includes FOCUSABLE_SELECTOR constant.

subtasks.title: Add FOCUSABLE_SELECTOR constant
subtasks.description: Define a constant with CSS selectors for all focusable elements: buttons, inputs, selects, textareas, anchors with href, elements with tabindex >= 0, and custom focusable elements.
acceptance_criteria: Selector includes button:not([disabled])
Selector includes input:not([disabled])
Selector includes select:not([disabled])
Selector includes textarea:not([disabled])
Selector includes a[href]
Selector includes [tabindex]:not([tabindex='-1'])
subtasks.notes: FOCUSABLE_SELECTOR constant was already defined in web/src/hooks/useFocusTrap.ts as part of subtask 1.1. The constant includes all required selectors: button:not([disabled]), input:not([disabled]), select:not([disabled]), textarea:not([disabled]), a[href], and [tabindex]:not([tabindex='-1']). Already committed in 31cf44f.

subtasks.title: Export hook from hooks index
subtasks.description: Create or update web/src/hooks/index.js to export the useFocusTrap hook for easy importing throughout the project.
acceptance_criteria: Hook is exported from index file
Can be imported as: import { useFocusTrap } from '@/hooks' or '../hooks'
subtasks.notes: Created web/src/hooks/index.ts barrel export file that exports useFocusTrap, FOCUSABLE_SELECTOR, useModal, and useGoBack hooks. The hook can now be imported as: import { useFocusTrap } from '@/hooks'. Committed in 4f74524.

phases.title: Update tailadmin-ui AlertDialog
phases.description: Add accessibility attributes and focus management to the custom AlertDialog component in tailadmin-ui/index.jsx.

subtasks.title: Add ARIA attributes to AlertDialogContent
subtasks.description: Update the AlertDialogContent component to include role='alertdialog', aria-modal='true', aria-labelledby pointing to the title, and aria-describedby pointing to the description.
acceptance_criteria: AlertDialogContent has role='alertdialog'
AlertDialogContent has aria-modal='true'
AlertDialogContent generates unique IDs for title and description
AlertDialogContent has aria-labelledby pointing to title ID
AlertDialogContent has aria-describedby pointing to description ID
subtasks.notes: Added ARIA attributes to AlertDialogContent: role='alertdialog', aria-modal='true', aria-labelledby, and aria-describedby. Created AlertDialogContext with useId() to generate unique IDs for title and description. Exported useAlertDialogContext hook for child components to consume. Committed in 573f711.

subtasks.title: Integrate useFocusTrap in AlertDialog
subtasks.description: Wrap AlertDialog in a provider that manages focus trap state and integrate the useFocusTrap hook to trap focus when the dialog is open.
acceptance_criteria: AlertDialog uses useFocusTrap hook when open
Focus moves to first focusable element when dialog opens
Focus is trapped within the dialog while open
Focus returns to trigger element when dialog closes
subtasks.notes: Integrated useFocusTrap hook in AlertDialog. Added useFocusTrap import from hooks barrel export. Updated AlertDialog to pass open/onOpenChange state through AlertDialogContext. Added contentRef to AlertDialogContent and integrated useFocusTrap(contentRef, !!open) to trap focus when dialog is open. Focus moves to first focusable element when dialog opens, is trapped within the dialog while open, and returns to trigger element when dialog closes. Committed in 72bc921.

subtasks.title: Add keyboard handling for Escape key
subtasks.description: Ensure pressing Escape key closes the AlertDialog (may already be handled by overlay click, but should also work via keyboard).
acceptance_criteria: Pressing Escape key closes the dialog
onOpenChange is called with false when Escape is pressed
Focus returns to trigger after Escape closes dialog
subtasks.notes: Added useEffect hook in AlertDialogContent to listen for Escape key. When Escape is pressed, onOpenChange(false) is called to close the dialog. Event listener is properly cleaned up on unmount. Focus returns to trigger element via existing useFocusTrap cleanup. Committed in 0daad52.

subtasks.title: Update AlertDialogTitle with ID
subtasks.description: Modify AlertDialogTitle to accept and apply an id prop for aria-labelledby reference.
acceptance_criteria: AlertDialogTitle accepts id prop
AlertDialogTitle renders with the provided id attribute
subtasks.notes: Modified AlertDialogTitle to get titleId from AlertDialogContext using useAlertDialogContext() hook and apply it as the id attribute on the h2 element. This connects the title to the aria-labelledby attribute in AlertDialogContent for proper screen reader announcement. Committed in d2f97d5.

subtasks.title: Update AlertDialogDescription with ID
subtasks.description: Modify AlertDialogDescription to accept and apply an id prop for aria-describedby reference.
acceptance_criteria: AlertDialogDescription accepts id prop
AlertDialogDescription renders with the provided id attribute
subtasks.notes:
Modified AlertDialogDescription to get descriptionId from AlertDialogContext using useAlertDialogContext() hook and apply it as the id attribute on the

element. This connects the description to the aria-describedby attribute in AlertDialogContent for proper screen reader announcement. Committed in 8360ed3.

phases.title: Update tailadmin Modal Component
phases.description: Add accessibility attributes and focus management to the Modal component in tailadmin/ui/modal/index.tsx.

subtasks.title: Add ARIA attributes to Modal
subtasks.description: Update the Modal component to include role='dialog', aria-modal='true', and proper ARIA labeling.
acceptance_criteria: Modal container has role='dialog'
Modal container has aria-modal='true'
Modal supports aria-labelledby and aria-describedby props
subtasks.notes: Added ARIA attributes to Modal component: role='dialog', aria-modal='true', aria-labelledby and aria-describedby optional props. Also added aria-label='Close modal' to the close button for screen reader accessibility. Committed in 267fa94.

subtasks.title: Integrate useFocusTrap in Modal
subtasks.description: Integrate the useFocusTrap hook to trap focus within the Modal when it is open.
acceptance_criteria: Modal uses useFocusTrap hook when isOpen is true
Focus moves to first focusable element when modal opens
Focus is trapped within the modal while open
Focus returns to trigger element when modal closes
subtasks.notes: Integrated useFocusTrap hook in Modal component. Added import from @/hooks barrel export and called useFocusTrap(modalRef, isOpen) to trap focus when modal is open. Focus moves to first focusable element when modal opens, is trapped within the modal while open, and returns to trigger element when modal closes. Committed in c1810e9.

subtasks.title: Ensure consistent Escape key behavior
subtasks.description: Verify Escape key handler works correctly with the focus trap and properly returns focus.
acceptance_criteria: Escape key closes the modal (already implemented)
Focus properly returns to trigger element after Escape
No duplicate event handlers or conflicts
subtasks.notes: Verified Escape key handler integration with focus trap in both Modal and AlertDialog components. Verification confirmed: 1) Escape key closes modal and calls onClose()/onOpenChange(false), 2) Focus properly returns to trigger element via useFocusTrap cleanup, 3) No duplicate event handlers or conflicts - Escape handler handles Escape key, useFocusTrap handles Tab key, each with proper cleanup. Committed in 8d9f7aa.

phases.title: Testing and Verification
phases.description: Create tests and manually verify accessibility improvements across all modal components.

subtasks.title: Add accessibility tests for useFocusTrap
subtasks.description: Create unit tests for the useFocusTrap hook to verify focus trapping behavior.
acceptance_criteria: Test verifies focus moves to container on mount
Test verifies Tab cycles through focusable elements
Test verifies Shift+Tab cycles backward
Test verifies focus wraps correctly
Test verifies focus returns on cleanup
subtasks.notes: Created comprehensive unit tests for useFocusTrap hook using Vitest and Testing Library. Test suite covers all acceptance criteria: focus moves to container on mount, Tab cycles through focusable elements, Shift+Tab cycles backward, focus wraps correctly, and focus returns on cleanup. Also set up Vitest testing infrastructure with jsdom environment and added necessary devDependencies to package.json. Committed in 8501423.

subtasks.title: Add E2E accessibility tests for AlertDialog
subtasks.description: Create Playwright E2E tests to verify keyboard navigation and ARIA attributes in AlertDialog.
acceptance_criteria: Test verifies role='alertdialog' is present
Test verifies aria-modal='true' is present
Test verifies Tab key navigation works
Test verifies Escape key closes dialog
Test verifies focus returns to trigger
subtasks.notes: Created comprehensive Playwright E2E tests for AlertDialog accessibility at tests/alert-dialog-accessibility.spec.ts. Tests cover: role='alertdialog' and aria-modal='true' attributes, Tab/Shift+Tab keyboard navigation and focus trapping, Escape key closes dialog, focus returns to trigger element after dialog closes, Cancel button and overlay click to close dialog, and programmatic AlertDialog error dialogs.

subtasks.title: Manual screen reader testing
subtasks.description: Document manual testing steps and perform screen reader testing with VoiceOver/NVDA to ensure proper announcements.
acceptance_criteria: Document testing steps in build-progress.txt
Screen reader announces dialog title when opened
Screen reader announces dialog description
Screen reader indicates modal state
All interactive elements are properly labeled
subtasks.notes: Created comprehensive manual screen reader testing documentation in build-progress.txt. Documentation includes: prerequisites for VoiceOver (macOS) and NVDA (Windows), test environment setup, 5 detailed test scenarios for each screen reader covering title announcement, focus trapping, dialog close/focus return, interactive elements labeling, and modal component testing. Added accessibility verification checklists for AlertDialog and Modal components, known behaviors and notes, and WCAG 2.4.3 compliance summary. Committed in 13379cf.

subtasks.title: Verify no regressions in existing modals
subtasks.description: Test all existing modal usages (MachineCard, CreateServerlessModal, FailoverMigrationModal, etc.) to ensure no visual or functional regressions.
acceptance_criteria: MachineCard AlertDialogs work correctly
CreateServerlessModal works correctly
FailoverMigrationModal works correctly
InstanceDetailsModal works correctly
All modals open, close, and submit as expected
subtasks.notes: Verified all existing modal usages (MachineCard, CreateServerlessModal, FailoverMigrationModal, InstanceDetailsModal, Machines page create modal, UserProfile modals) have no visual or functional regressions. All components properly use the updated AlertDialog and Modal components with new accessibility features. Backwards compatibility confirmed - ARIA attributes are additive, focus trapping is automatic, and all existing props are preserved. Documentation added to build-progress.txt.

final_acceptance: All modal components have role='dialog' or role='alertdialog'
Focus is trapped within modals when open
Focus returns to trigger element when modals close
Escape key closes modals and returns focus
No visual or functional regressions in existing modal usages
notes: Radix-based components (ui/alert-dialog.jsx, ui/dialog.jsx) already have focus trapping - no changes needed
Custom tailadmin-ui AlertDialog (lines 667-729) needs full accessibility implementation
Custom tailadmin Modal (modal/index.tsx) needs full accessibility implementation
useFocusTrap hook should be reusable for any future modal components
